intro: Borreria bradei, commonly known as the Mexican broom, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent tube. Borreria bradei is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
